questions.question_text:
A furniture retailer wants its online buyers to first choose their underlying need, which will then direct them to the related list of accessories and product parts of the configurable furniture product. The retailer intends to do this by presenting standard questions to the online buyers on their needs, and then presenting the related list of accessories and parts through dynamic user interfaces.
What step is required to enable this feature?

discussion.content:
A. Add a supplemental structure to the root node of the item-based model in the workspace area of the Configurator.

https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/supply-chain-management/20a/facmg/model-structure.html#FACMG1831482
You add supplemental structure to existing item-based models.

To add supplemental structure:
Add an item-based model to a workspace, and open it for editing. The model will be automatically locked by your login ID. You must lock a model to edit it.
On the Edit Configurator Model page, select the root node of the model, choose Create from the Actions menu.
Note: You can only create supplemental structure on the root node of an item-based model.
Select the type of supplemental structure feature to create.
In the dialog box for the feature type, enter the required attributes for the feature.
In the Details region, you can modify the attributes of the feature.
Repeat these steps to add other features to the model.
Save your changes to the model. If you don't save, you will be prompted to save when you leave the edit page.
Optionally, test the effects of your changes by clicking the Test Model button.
